item.title: [DISTRELEC-3078] Newsletter registration page - please add * to all MANDATORY fields
item.description:
The registration form on the newsletter has the last 2 fields mandatory, however they do now look so.

Please add * in front of the last 2 fields

  • In welcher Branche sind Sie tätig?
  • Welche Produkt Kategorien interessieren Sie?
item.summary: Newsletter registration page - please add * to all MANDATORY fields

comments.comment:
Checked it:
- actually the field "In welcher Branche sind Sie tätig?" is not mandatory. A validation in the front end was added by mistake. It has been removed.
- the field "Welche Produkt Kategorien interessieren Sie?" is indeed mandatory and was missing the validation. It has already been added.

-> see the attached screenshot from the dev environment, this will be in the next deployment. No further action needed, resolving this ticket.

Could be a data issue...

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3002] Order Confirmation as a Guest Customer
item.description: The data that is sent through the Order Confirmation E-Mail is Dummy data. Please see attached.
item.summary: Order Confirmation as a Guest Customer

comments.comment: please find above the Outlook message and the print screen from the Order Confirmation page. They do not match.

@Oana

The "Re Bestellungen.msg" File is really hard to read.
Can you please make a print screen or attach the only the text of the mail.

Thanks
René

Same for me, I cannot open the .msg file.

But either way: the contents of the email template need to be maintained in the respective property files, Nabil should be able to help.
Or is the order number / some system-generated content wrong? In that case it would be a task for Lukas.

Did some research in the HMC and in the Test Gmail account:

Order YQY (the one of the screenshot)
- order date in hybris: 01/30/2014 6:33:55 PM
- email address / user in hybris: distrelec.testing+700@gmail.com
- corresponding email was received in the gmail account on 30.1. at 18:33 (see screenshot "GuestOrderMail-YQY")

Order ZIB (the one of the email)
- order date in hybris: 30.01.2014 16:03:24
- email address / user in hybris: distrelec.testing+privat@gmail.com
- corresponding email was reseived in the gmail account on 30.1. at 16:03 (see screenshot "GuestOrderMail-ZIB")

I think we don't actually have an issue but just a misunderstanding. The data suggests all is correct.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2972] Product Name: Special characters are not imported to Hybris or displayed wrong
item.description:
See screenshots.

Case A: Product names may contain special characters such as "," or "/", but those characters are not being transferred to Hybris. This causes quite strange product names.

Example product: 11057280

Case B: Product name contains special character such as 3/4 symbol, which is being displayed wrong (as "?") in product title.

Example product: 17500952
item.summary: Product Name: Special characters are not imported to Hybris or displayed wrong

comments.comment: Product title should read "DE,AT" instead of "DEAT"

the characters are missing in the PIM export
<Value>Microsoft Natural Ergonomic Keyboard 4000 DEAT USB</Value>
the 3/4 symbol is correct in the PIM export and is also correct in hybris (see detailpage), the problem with the 3/4 happens either in the FF export or FF response. I will check with Cornel.

The "¾" symbol is exported properly to the FF export file (see ff_export_17500358.txt).

In the FACT-Finder response the "¾" symbol is replaced by a "?" (see ff_response_17500358.txt). In demo shop the sign isn't correct neither.

I've created a sub-task (DISTRELEC-2973) to track this issue.
wir sind am testen / umsetzen
done. test export erstellt und geprüft. nächster live file = (pim export start today, auf NFS heute ca 22.00 - ready für Y-Import)
verified

attachment.name: LED 5mm Distrelec AT Website - Google Chrome_2014-01-29_10-48-57.jpg
attachment.author: mfehske

attachment.name: Suchen keyboard USB Distrelec AT Website - Mozilla Firefox_2014-01-29_11-08-23.jpg
attachment.author: mfehske

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3093] EOL product not (100%) correctly indicated
item.description:
If the SalesStatus of a product changes to 60, we set an endOfLifeDate to that point in time (e.g. 05.02.2014 14:53:15).

The logic to redirect the user to the EOL CMS page (/de/Product%20EOL/cms/productEOL) is inaccurate. The redirect will first happen the next day.
=> between 05.02.2014 14:53:15 and 06.02.2014 00:00:00 the detail page will still be displayed.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3066] "404 Not Found" during approval process - 2
item.description:
OS: Windows 7 Professional
Browser: IE 11.0.9600.16476 / Update Versions: 11.0.2

Login as distrelec.testing+17-2@gmail.com, pw distrelec, go to product with id 001425, add 25 units to the cart, continue checkout, approval request is sent to the master account, log out.
Login as distrelec.testing+17@gmail.com, pw distrelec, go to the order manager, approval requests, click to the order.
Click on "Accept" button, don't check the box with the terms and conditions and click on continue, page "404 Not found" opens. (img_378-380_pzu)

THE SAME BEHAVIOUR ON LIVE SHOP.

Now, if the button "Reject" is pushed a note field opens, just click on send without fill in anything into this field ends in a 404. (img_374-377_pzu)

THE SAME BEHAVIOUR ON LIVE SHOP.

2) Header Social Images und Links
3) The Big Mood Image below the header must be replaced in every email template. It must be maintainable on a per email template basis by the author. The Image must be 600px wide.
I attached the football field image which should be used as mood image as a default (if possible).
images are content and have to be maintained via the cms cockpit

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3047] Payment Exception
item.description: An unexpected exception appears if I try to pay with credit card on prod.

comments.comment:
Bei CH kommt der Fehler nicht.
At kann ich im moment nicht testen da der DNS nicht geht.
https://www.netkauf.de/paygate/payssl.aspx sollte doch eigentlich noch verschiedene Parameter enthalten?

AT has a different merchant ID but "pg_51869" but the template is the same.

- Template=pg_50702
- MerchantID=pg_51869

The MerchantId has changed for AT
 - pg_51869

But the TemplateId has to be the same:
- pg_50702 (for prod)
- pg_50702t (for test)

Added new configuration parameter:

distrelec.payment.templateId=pg_50702

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3038] Footer links are not displayed correctly
item.description: Footer links are not displayed correctly. The link is sometimes missing for level 1 nodes.
item.summary: Footer links are not displayed correctly

comments.comment: please explain further.

That was just a ticket to track the bug we have found together. Some times the link was missing on the level 1 nodes in the footer.
I just assigned the ticket to you so that you can check it after the deployment of v1.0.3.1 if everything is working correct.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3034] Subuser cannot set password
item.description:
Browser: IE8 and Chrome

  • Admin has created subuser
  • Subuser got the "Set password" mail and clicks on the button.
  • Subuser fills password into the fields and clicks on "change password"

Result: New "change password" without description text and page title opens.

comments.comment:
The problem is that the token doesn't get invalidated after it is used and a password was set. If you click again on the link in the email a second time, you get to the reset page again, can set a password once again, but that doesn't get saved, and the target page contains no error.

Fix:
If the user clicks on the token link in the email after he has already set a new password, the target page should be an error notification that the token has been used, with a link to the "forgot password page" for the case the user needs another token.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3018] RMA confirmation fly out
item.description:
Please change the text in the RMA confirmation fly out
from: "Ihre RMA (Rücksendenummer): XXXXXXXX" to "Interne Distrelec Antragsnummer: XXXXXXXX"

and from
"Es wurde eine Bestätigungsmail an Ihre E-Mail-Adresse gesandt XXXXXXXXXX"

to

"In unserem Distrelec Reparaturzentrum kümmern sich Experten schnellstmöglich um Ihr Anliegen und werden Sie kontaktieren, um Ihnen Ihre RMA-Nummer und das weitere Vorgehen mitzuteilen.

Bitte beachten Sie: Wir können nur Warenrücksendungen akzeptieren, denen eine gültige RMA-Nummer beiliegt."

comments.comment:
Nabil, I could not find the word RMA in HMC. Please help. If you give me the name of the property, please reassign this.

Thanks!
working on small corrections on above text, please hold until further notice
Discussed minor corrections with Florian, changes are reflected in the description of the ticket. This change can be done now.

Please remove the first line:
"Es wurde eine Bestätigungsmail an Ihre E-Mail-Adresse gesandt XXXXXXXXXX"

The first line has been removed, the email address has been removed as well. The text was changed.

The full correct version should be available for the next deployment.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3010] Shop email sender/subjects
item.description:
We should change the naming of the senders and the subjects of the shop mails as followed:

Web shop registration

  • Sender: "Kundendienst" to "Distrelec Kundendienst"
  • Subject: "Ihre Anmeldung bei Distrelec" to "Willkommen bei Distrelec"

Order Confirmation

  • Sender "Kundendienst" to "Distrelec Kundendienst"^
  • Subject "Bestellung" to "Ihre Bestellung"

Newsletter Registration

  • Sender "Registration Newsletter" to "Distrelec Newsletter"
  • Subject "Willkommen bei Distrelec" to "Bestätigen Sie Ihre Registrierung"

Return request:

  • Sender "Customerservice" to "Distrelec Kundendienst"
  • Subject "Ihre Rücksendung"

Quotation:

  • Subject: "Distrelec Preis- und Mengenanfrage"

Share Search:

  • Subject: "Suchverlauf teilen" to "<sender name> möchte ein Distrelec Suchergebnis mit Ihnen teilen"

Share basket:

  • Subject: "<sender name> möchte einen Distrelec Warenkorb mit Ihnen teilen"

Share Product:

  • Subject: "<sender name> möchte ein Distrelec Produkt mit Ihnen teilen"

Share Compare:

  • Subject: "<sender name> möchte eine Produktliste mit Ihnen teilen"

Forgot Password:

  • Sender: "Kundendienst" to "Distrelec Kundendienst"
  • Subject: "Passwort vergessen" to "Passwort zurücksetzen"

Order approval:

  • Sender: "Kundendienst" to "Distrelec Kundendienst"
  • Subject: Ihre Bestellanf​rage

Order rejection:

  • Sender: "Kundendienst" to "Distrelec Kundendienst"
  • Subject: "Ihre Bestellanf​rage wurde abgelehnt"

Order approval:

  • Sender: "Kundendienst" to "Distrelec Kundendienst"
  • Subject:"Ihre Bestellung"

comments.comment:
Suggest the following changes to the above texts:

Order Confirmation:
Subject "Bestellung" to "Ihre Bestellung" => "Ihre Bestellung bei Distrelec" (please approve or disapprove)


Newsletter Registration
Subject "Willkommen bei Distrelec" to "Bestätigen Sie Ihre Registration" => "Bestätigen Sie Ihre Registrierung" ("Registration" is not a German word)


All "Share" Emails
"Geteilter <subject>" sounds like "in mehrere Stücke geteilt"

Suggest the following pattern:
"<Sender First Name> <Sender Last Name> möchte ein Distrelec Produkt / ein Distrelec Suchergebnis / einen Distrelec Warenkorb / eine Distrelec Vergleichsliste mit Ihnen teilen" (please approve or disapprove)

Florian,
please see my above comment and approve / disapprove : )
The texts then need to be maintained in the properties (or maybe also possible in the HMC), please coordinate with Nabil.

Order Confirmation:
Subject "Bestellung" to "Ihre Bestellung" => "Ihre Bestellung" (please approve or disapprove) --> stays the same


Newsletter Registration
Subject "Willkommen bei Distrelec" to "Bestätigen Sie Ihre Registration" => "Bestätigen Sie Ihre Registrierung" ("Registration" is not a German word) ---> I agree


All "Share" Emails
"Geteilter <subject>" sounds like "in mehrere Stücke geteilt"

Suggest the following pattern:
"<Sender First Name> <Sender Last Name> möchte ein Distrelec Produkt / ein Distrelec Suchergebnis / einen Distrelec Warenkorb / eine Distrelec Vergleichsliste mit Ihnen teilen" (please approve or disapprove)

--> I agree

Raphael, please make sure the properties are updated accordingly (or that they can be maintained in the HMC)
I updated the description of this ticket with the change based on the comments. The description contains the texts as they should be.
I've added "Forgot Password"

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2975] Can't write text in the Body (warning component) with IE 11
item.description:
Can't create a warning component with IE 11.

CMS Login -> New Content Page -> Create a Warning Component -> Try to write in the Body doesn't work.

With FF and Chrome works.
item.summary: Can't write text in the Body (warning component) with IE 11

comments.comment:
as soon as the FontFormat dropdown is configured, it's not possible to edit something with the wysiwyg editor in IE.

so we have two variants:

1) we need this FontFormat -> it's not possible to use IE
2) we remove the FontFormat -> every browser works
Nando: can you please check which way we should go?

Kris,
please see Pascal's comment above: is the font format dropdown needed?
Yes, we Need it. Because other persons have to work with it.
resolving as no change is required.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2837] AT URL favicon missing and DEV label on top left corner

distrelec.at
Favicon of URL is missing.
Plus DEV label to be removed
item.summary: AT URL favicon missing and DEV label on top left corner

comments.comment: favicon is available
Dominic: How can we disable the DEV label?!
to disabled the dev label, set ${isProd} to false (which is already done on prod and test).

item.title: [DISTRELEC-2546] ProductFinder: Price ranges for different currencies?
item.description:
Price ranges in ProductFinder are being created globally, and without currency.

When creating a Product Finder for a category with price ranges e.g. 1-5, 5-10, 10-100, those ranges will then apply for each country and currency setting.

So Swedish customers would be able to select 1-5 SEK, 5-10 SEK or 10-100 SEK, while Austrian customers would get to choose between 1-5 EUR, 5-10 EUR or 10-100 EUR.

(In addition, the frontend would only display numbers without currency indicators, since range labels are globally defined.)
item.summary: ProductFinder: Price ranges for different currencies?

comments.comment:
Cornel, can you please assess a possible solution approach for this issue?
For the AT go-live this is not a problem yet, multiple currencies will only become relevant with the go-live of CH.

Handle multiple currencies (see currency.png):
Currently a price value has just a double value defining the price. This value could be replace by a list of "DistProductFinderPriceDefinition". Each price definition has a double price value and an optional currency. If the currency is set, this price definition is valid only for user sessions with the same currency.

Handle multiple countries (see country.png):
If it is required to have a different product finder configuration for different countries the data model has to be adjusted. A possible solution is to have links from the various product finder objects (ProductFinderConfiguration, -Column, -Group, -Value) to a single or to multiple countries. If such a product finder object has a country set it will only be displayed if the current user session applies to the same country.

Adi,
can you please assess whether it would be advised to do the data model changes still before the go-live?
The rest of the change is not critical for AT.

Extending the data model and modifying the logic is possible without major risks. We will implement the CR in the future 1.1 (or 2.0) release after checking the exact requirements.

To clarify:
Do we need just a currency depending configuration or do we also need a country depending configuration?
Discussed with florian. Decision: we just need a currency depending configuration for price ranges.

Hi Cornel,

before you start with this change request please make the needed adaptions of your work station to work on the correct svn branche. A written manual will be provided by Adrian within the next few days.

Requirement has been implemented.

A ProductFinder value can be restricted to a specific currency (see ProductFinder_CurrencyRestriction.png).

The value is displayed if:
a) there is no currency restriction.
b) the currency restriction is equal to the current session currency.
